title: What’s at Stake as Netanyahu and Trump Meet in Washington
description: With the fighting in Iran over, President Trump is considering whether to pursue a new nuclear agreement with Tehran. He is also urging a new cease-fire deal to end the fighting in Gaza.
author: Aaron Boxerman
excerpt: With the fighting in Iran over, President Trump is considering whether to pursue a new nuclear agreement with Tehran. He is also urging a new cease-fire deal to end the fighting in Gaza.

With the fighting in Iran over, President Trump is considering whether to pursue a new nuclear agreement with Tehran. He is also urging a new cease-fire deal to end the fighting in Gaza.

July 7, 2025Updated 1:25 p.m. ET

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel was set to meet President Trump in Washington on Monday as each pushed his own priorities on Gaza, Iran and other critical issues in the Middle East.

Mr. Trump wants to secure a cease-fire deal in Gaza to stop the fighting between Israel and Hamas. Mr. Netanyahu and Hamas have both thrown up obstacles. Hamas wants strong guarantees that the talks will lead to a permanent end to the war, and Mr. Netanyahu has vowed to carry on fighting until Hamas is eliminated.

Mr. Netanyahu, after Israeli and U.S. strikes on Iran in June, has to contend with Mr. Trump’s desire to seek a diplomatic deal with Iran over its nuclear program — an issue he has long viewed with suspicion.

Here’s what’s at stake in the upcoming meeting between the two leaders, their third since Mr. Trump returned to office.

The future of the Gaza war

Many in Israel and Gaza hope Mr. Netanyahu’s meeting with Mr. Trump will pave the way for a new truce that would end 21 months of war and free the remaining hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners.
